decision_conditions: The development to which this permission relates shall be begun not later than the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.

Reason: To comply with Section 91 of the Town & Country Planning Act 1990. | The development hereby approved shall be carried out in accordance with drawing / document title number(s): Design & Access Statement prepared by Rosewood Family Care dated May 2024; 010-P-002 Existing Plans; 010-P-003 Existing Elevations; 010-P-004 Existing Sections; 010-P-005 Proposed Plans; 010-P-006 Proposed Elevations; 010-P-007 Proposed Sections
Reason: For the avoidance of doubt and in the interests of proper planning.

| The sound insulation of the floor/ceiling /wall structures separating different types of rooms/uses, namely, bedroom adjoining/ above communal kitchen/living/bathroom, shall be enhanced by at least 5dB above the recommended ADE Building Regulations values. Approved details shall be implemented prior to occupation of the development and thereafter be permanently retained.

Reason: In the interests of the living conditions of the future occupiers of the site in accordance with policies 7A & 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policies 1.1 and 1.2 of the Ealing Development (Core) Strategy (2012), policies D6 and D14 of the London Plan (2021), the National Planning Policy Framework (2023), Standard 30 London Housing SPG 2016 and Ealing SPG10.

| Cycle storage for a minimum of one bicycle space shall be provided within the curtilage of the development, within secure, lockable compounds in accordance with all adopted standards prior to the first occupation of the building. The storage spaces shall be permanently retained thereafter.
Reason:  To provide adequate bicycle storage in accordance with policy and T5 of the London Plan (2021).

| Notwithstanding the provisions of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) Order 2015 as amended by the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) (England) Order 2015, the hereby permitted residential care home shall only be used under Class C2 and not for any other use without permission of the Local Planning Authority obtained by the submission of a planning application.

Reason: To protect the character and amenity of the area and to safeguard the employment land in accordance with 1.1 and 1.2 of the Ealing Development (Core) Strategy (2012), Policies D3, D14, E8 of the London Plan, policies 7A & 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), Ealing SPG10 and the National Planning Policy Framework (2023).

| The hereby permitted residential care home capacity shall be maximum three children with the age range between 8 - 18 years. The property should be supervised at all times by qualified staff members.
Reason: To protect and safeguard the future residents in accordance with policy S3 of the London Plan (2021).
| The hereby approved residential care home shall be registered and operate under an Ofsted registration. All placements at the home shall be appropriately matched by age.
Reason: To protect and safeguard the future residents in accordance with policy S3 of the London Plan (2021).
description: Change of use from single dwellinghouse (Use Class C3) to residential care home (Use Class C2) for children with Special Educational Needs and Disabilities, learning difficulties and emotional and behavioural difficulties.
